name: xpexd
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0

stmt.origin: syl2anc(w0, wcel(cxp(c0, c1), universe), wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c3))
stmt.pretty: syl2anc(w0, (c0 × c1)∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ c2, c1 ∈ c3)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cxp(c0, c1), universe))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c3))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c3)), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), universe))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cxp(c0, c1), universe))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c3))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c3)), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), universe))

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c3)), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), universe))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cxp(c0, c1), universe))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c3))

comment: The Cartesian product of two sets is a set. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)
